channel.title: 华尔街日报

item.title: 美国人找到了追逐容易赚钱的新方法。让人们按 B7 键。

item.title: 如果 TikTok 被禁，它可能会起诉政府，迫使法官权衡国家安全目标与视频应用巨头及其用户的第一修正案权利。
item.description:
If TikTok is banned, it could sue the government, forcing judges to weigh national security objectives against the First Amendment rights of the video app juggernaut and its users https://t.co/P5IFcCCrMK https://t.co/P5IFcCCrMK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 为了摆脱多年来因大流行病而造成的与世隔绝的局面，中国正在释放魅力，吸引外国人回国。这比过去更难推销。
item.description:
China is turning on the charm to lure back foreigners, part of an effort to shed years of pandemic-induced isolation that’s sapping its economy. It’s a tougher sell than it used to be. https://t.co/H1xCCCVyRd https://t.co/H1xCCCVyRd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 远离东京和京都的旅游人群，日本的一条多日徒步旅行线路让游客沉浸在 2011 年遭受毁灭性海啸袭击的社区的文化和美食之中
item.description:
Far from the tourist crowds of Tokyo and Kyoto, a Japanese multi-day hiking trail immerses travelers in the culture and cuisine of a community hit by a devastating tsunami in 2011 https://t.co/BPWQCIBgGt https://t.co/BPWQCIBgGt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 惹怒 NFL。聘请一位 "F "爆主持人把赌注押在流媒体上ESPN 的吉米-皮塔洛（Jimmy Pitaro）正在走出自己的舒适区，以确保这家体育巨头的未来。

item.title: 精英圈子里的职场妈妈们对魔幻蘑菇赞不绝口："在我接触的每 10 位女性中，就有 8 位在服用微型毒品"。

item.title: 航空公司首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）今年有望获得 1 亿多美元的奖金。F 炸弹、出言不逊的笑话和醉醺醺的晚餐都是他的口头禅。
item.description:
The airline CEO Michael O’Leary is on course for a $100 million-plus bonus this year. F-bombs, off-color jokes and drunken dinners are all part of his lore. https://t.co/IYubO4Slu8 https://t.co/IYubO4Slu8

item.title: 麦肯锡、波士顿咨询公司（BCG）和德勤（Deloitte）等老牌大型咨询公司受雇为全球最大的企业预测未来，但它们却弄错了自己的命运--其后果是一团糟
item.description:

item.title: 宠物石是 20 世纪 70 年代在美国兴起的一种被遗忘的怪异时尚，如今在韩国再次出现。这次的主题是放松身心。
item.description:
Pet rocks, a kooky and best-forgotten fad of 1970s America, are resurfacing in South Korea. This time, it’s all about unwinding. https://t.co/BLQjCJDR62 https://t.co/BLQjCJDR62

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: "我太年轻了，不适合变老"。人们不遗余力地减少或阻止白发苍苍的过程。一些研究衰老问题的科学家认为，他们可能有所发现。
item.description:
“I’m too young to be old.” People are going to great lengths to reduce or halt the graying process. Some scientists of aging think they might be onto something. https://t.co/03Y2mW8uXj https://t.co/03Y2mW8uXj

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 丹-尼尔写道："福特 F-250 的设计者总是拒绝采用 21 世纪的解决方案，而倾向于使用更古老、更原始、更低效的技术，但最终却采用了更强大的技术。
item.description:
At every turn, Ford F-250's designers rejected 21st-century solutions in favor of older, more primitive, less efficient—and ultimately more robust—technologies, writes Dan Neil https://t.co/DICetA31o0 https://t.co/DICetA31o0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: "一位设计专家说："过高的床头板会让人感觉宏伟而荒诞，就像是为玛丽-安托瓦内特设计的一样。这些建议和其他建议，请参阅我们的《精巧床铺指南》。
item.description:
“Too-tall headboards can feel grandiose and absurd, like they are made for Marie Antoinette,” said one design pro. These tips and others in our guide to the well-made bed. https://t.co/IetxqxglqH https://t.co/IetxqxglqH

item.title: "Girls5Eva》主演 Busy Philipps 谈及自己小时候的怪癖："我有很强的主见，很容易迷恋自己喜欢的东西，这让其他孩子感到焦虑，他们希望我像他们一样--安静、酷。
item.description:
"Girls5Eva" star Busy Philipps on embracing her weirdness as a kid: "I had strong opinions and easily became obsessed with things I liked, which caused anxiety in other kids who wanted me to be like them—quiet and cool." https://t.co/2S3AYqcNuO https://t.co/2S3AYqcNuO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 十年前，在比弗利伍德花二三十万美元就能买到一栋房子。现在呢？"你不可能以低于300万美元的价格买到任何一条黄金街道上的地皮"。
